projectPurpose: To provide a high-performance JavaScript and TypeScript module bundler written in Rust, aiming for significantly faster build times and serving as the future bundler for Vite, while maintaining compatibility with the Rollup API and plugin ecosystem.
mainFeatures: Designed to be the future bundler for Vite
Can be used as a standalone bundler
Includes built-in features like platform presets, TS/JSX transforms, Node.js module resolution, ESM/CJS interop, CSS bundling (experimental), and minification (WIP)

alternatives.name: Webpack
mainFeatures: Bundles JavaScript, CSS, images, and other assets

alternatives.name: esbuild
mainFeatures: Built-in support for JS, CSS, TS, JSX

alternatives.name: SWC
mainFeatures: Can be used as a Webpack loader

marketPositioning: Rolldown is positioned as a high-performance, Rust-based JavaScript and TypeScript bundler that offers a compelling combination of speed (similar to esbuild) and ecosystem compatibility (leveraging Rollup's API and plugins). Its primary strategic positioning is as the future core bundler for the Vite build tool, providing a faster underlying build experience for Vite users. Additionally, it aims to serve as a standalone bundler, potentially replacing Rollup for users seeking speed improvements or offering an esbuild alternative with more flexible chunking control. Its key differentiator is the blend of Rust-powered speed with strong compatibility with the established Rollup ecosystem.
